D&nbsp;</strong><span></span></p><p><span>Question 1: How does Layer 2 scaling work in blockchain networks?</span></p><p><span>A. By creating a separate layer on top of the main blockchain for processing transactions</span></p><p><span>Question 2: What does &quot;zk&quot; stand for in &quot;zkEVM rollups&quot;?</span></p><p><span>A. Zero-knowledge</span></p><p><span>Question 3: What scalability feature does Linea incorporate into its framework?</span></p><p><span>B. Zero-knowledge proofs</span></p><p><span>Question 4: What is the meaning of &quot;BFT&#39;?</span></p><p><span>A. Byzantine Fault Tolerance, a consensus mechanism model</span></p><p><span>Question 5: What is the main scalability solution Linea uses?</span></p><p><span>D.zk-SNARK-based rollups</span></p><p><span>Question 6: In Ethereum, what is an uncle block?</span></p><p><span>A. A block that is not included in the main chain, but is still valid and contributes to the security of the chain</span></p><p><span>Question 7: What is a precompile in the Ethereum context?</span></p><p><span>C. A pre-deployed smart contract that performs computationally expensive operations orcryptographic functions</span></p><p><span>Question 8: How does the Smart Wallet feature enabled by Thirdweb in Linea improve user experience?</span></p><p><span>B. It hides blockchain complexities and simplifies interactions</span></p><p><span>Question 9: What is the purpose of contract templates like ThirdWeb in Linea?</span></p><p><span>D. They provide pre-built templates for quick smart contract deployment</span></p><p><span>Question 10: What does RPC stand for?</span></p><p><span>C. Remote Procedure Call</span></p><p><span>Question 11: In the context of Ethereum&#39;s upgrade, what was the primary function of the Beacon Chain?</span></p><p><span>D. To serve as the foundation for the new proof-of-stake consensus mechanism</span></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Medium&nbsp;é—®é¢˜åŠç­”æ¡ˆï¼šBACAC ACBAA ACDB</strong></p><p><span>Question 1: What is the purpose of an Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) bytecode?</span></p><p><span>B. To facilitate the execution of smart contracts on the Ethereum network</span></p><p><span>Question 2: What programming languages can be used to write smart contracts in Linea?</span></p><p><span>A. Any language that compiles to EVM bytecode</span></p><p><span>Question 3: In the context of rollups, what is a &quot;batch&quot;?</span></p><p><span>C. A group of transactions processed together</span></p><p><span>Question 4: In the context of blockchain, what does &quot;sharding&quot; refer to?</span></p><p><span>A. Splitting the blockchain into smaller pieces</span></p><p><span>Question 5: What is a Merkle tree in the context of blockchains?</span></p><p><span>C. A data structure used to efficiently verify the integrity of large sets of data</span></p><p><span>Question 6: What are Validators in the Linea network responsible for?</span></p><p><span>A. Executing transactions and producing blocks</span></p><p><span>Question 7: How is the account model in Linea different from Ethereum?</span></p><p><span>C. Linea and Ethereum both use the same account model</span></p><p><span>Question 8: What is a type 3 zkEVM?</span></p><p><span>B. An almost EVM-equivalent type of rollup network</span></p><p><span>Question 9: What is the primary purpose of the Message Bridge in Linea?</span></p><p><span>A. To enable communication between different blockchain networks</span></p><p><span>Question 10: What role does The Graph play in Linea&#39;s tooling and infrastructure?</span></p><p><span>A.
